comments:
Eclipse F2
Windows 2000

When I am debugging I get the exception below.  As a side effect of the 
exception, the perspective gets screwed up - views are shwoing tha do not 
belong to this perspective and several tool items are blank.

To cause the exception, 
1) Set "Default perspective for Run" to Debug
2) Go to the Java perspective.
3) Run the attached wad of code.

Created an attachment (id=1204)
Test program to write to console

I cannot reproduce with the test case...does this happen every time?

I get the Windows Media window and then a javaw.exe Application Error dialog 
(the memory could not be read...)

I also get the javacore written to the console and this is what I think causes 
the error.

You need to turn wrap on for the console in order to get the error.

Happens every time for me.

Marking as duplicate (Veronika - looks like you filed both of them :-)

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 17462 ***
